Backend

Class UserDataBase.UserDataBaseWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • Backend.UserDataBase.UserDataBaseWriter
  • Enclosing class:
    UserDataBase

    public static class UserDataBase.UserDataBaseWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the abstraction of the database I/O. It performs all the writing to the file system and retrieving from the filesystem. It is entirely safe to call all methods in this class at any time, as exceptions should always be handled.

    This writer will always write to the file UserDataBase.data within the present working directory. If that file does not exist in that location, it will create the file.

    • Method Detail

      • readFromFile

        public static java.util.LinkedList<User> readFromFile()
        This method reads from a file that is serialized. It must be in the UserDataBase format. Therefore, it must be a created .data file that is a serialized LinkedList of Users for it to read properly.
        Returns:
        A LinkedList object corresponding to the database, or null if the input is invalid.

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile(java.util.LinkedList<User> db)
        This method writes the parameter to a file in a serialized fashion.
        Parameters:
        db - A LinkedList object that must be written to a file.
